alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Franklin; Union (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 11:47PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN FRANKLIN, DELAWARE AND SOUTHEASTERN UNION COUNTIES IN CENTRAL OHIO THROUGH 1230 AM EDT... At 1146 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near New California, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Dublin, Westerville, Reynoldsburg, Delaware, Upper Arlington, Gahanna, Hilliard, Marysville, Worthington, Bexley, Powell, Sunbury, Plain City, Minerva Park, New California, Polaris, Easton, Whitehall and New Albany. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 110 and 111. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 111 and 136. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
